alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 7:35PM EDT until September 10 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Davidson County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until 1045 PM EDT. * At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Linwood, Summerfield, Jamestown, Oak Hollow Marina, Welcome, Lake Brandt, Lake Jeanette Marina, High Rock Lake and Lake Townsend. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
